intro: Piptospatha truncata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its woody, evergreen structure. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are alternate, compound, and have a distinctive truncate or notched appearance at the ends. Piptospatha truncata is well adapted to arid environments, with deep roots that help it survive in dry conditions.
